2. FIPS 140-2 Validation - Obtain validation certificates for cryptographic modules - Verify FIPS 140-2 compliance of all MFA components - CAC/PIV readers must be FIPS 140-2 validated - Hardware tokens must be FIPS 140-2 validated
3. Authentication Factor Types - Confirm at least TWO factor types implemented: * Something you KNOW (password/PIN) * Something you HAVE (CAC/PIV, hardware token, TOTP) * Something you ARE (biometric with liveness detection)
4. Privileged Account Requirements - Verify CAC/PIV authentication for administrative access (preferred) - If using alternative MFA: document justification and ISSM approval - Software TOTP acceptable for non-privileged access only
5. External Identity Provider (if applicable) - If using LDAP/SAML: verify IdP MFA strength compliance - Obtain documentation of IdP MFA configuration - Verify IdP enforces DoD-compliant MFA policies
6. Enrollment/Revocation Procedures - Document MFA enrollment process - Document MFA revocation/suspension procedures - Verify procedures align with account lifecycle management
7. ISSO/ISSM Approval - Obtain ISSO approval of MFA implementation plan - Obtain ISSM approval of authentication mechanism strength levels - Include approvals in security authorization package
